alert.note: Alert for Curry County; Roosevelt County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 8:39PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN ROOSEVELT AND SOUTHEASTERN CURRY COUNTIES THROUGH 915 PM MDT... At 839 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles west of West Camp to 12 miles southeast of Crossroads. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Causey, Lingo, and Arch. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.
